sentence.Network_en: We whomped our arch rival in the season's climactic football game.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在该季最精彩足球赛中打败了我们主要的对手.

sentence.Network_en: He is in the climactic moments of his career.
sentence.Network_cn: 他正处于事业的顶峰阶段。

sentence.Network_en: Instead, in the bright drawing - room, all seemed serene , anti - climactic, and slightly comic.
sentence.Network_cn: 相反地, 在这光亮的客厅里, 一切都显得安详 、 平淡, 而且稍有些滑稽.

list.abs: in the nursery we' ve got 21 climactic zones , so there' s lots to experiment with .我们的苗圃有21个不同的气候区域，所以可以开展很多试验。
CLIM 声波测井的井径范围climactic orogeny 主造山阶段Climactichnites 栅形迹
to reach a final or climactic stage ., 达到最终的或者定点的阶段.

the fears were a little overstated – not because the summit achieved much but because , in the US at least , this climactic moment came and went without anyone really noticing .上述担心有点夸大了，这不是因为此次峰会取得了很多成果，而是因为至少在美国，这一高潮时刻来了又去，人们几乎就没留意。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: formed irregularly from climax + -ic, probably influenced by climacteric

entry.tran: (故事或一系列事件中)最激动人心的，最精彩的
entry.def: A climactic moment in a story or a series of events is one in which a very exciting or important event occurs.

means.word_mean: 1. consisting of or causing a climax;
